sailpoint.api
Class PolicyUtil.EntitlementSummary

java.lang.Object
  sailpoint.api.PolicyUtil.EntitlementSummary
Enclosing class:
PolicyUtil
public static class PolicyUtil.EntitlementSummary
extends java.lang.Object

Model for representing entitlements related to SOD violations. This is returned by summarizeViolationEntitlements and is intended to be easy to use from Beanshell rules. Keep lists non-null and use .length regularly in the JSf pages.

Use the same model to convey information about both Role SOD violations and Entitlement SOD violations.

In practice there will only be one RoleSummary on each list because we always OR the roles in the SOD constraint sides, even though the model supports ANDing. So the first one that correlates becomes the one for the violation.

For Entitlement SOD there is one RoleSummary on each list but the role name will be null to indicate they are "free" entitlements. The rendering rule needs to check this to avoid omitting a Role: label.

Field Detail

left

public java.util.List<PolicyUtil.RoleSummary> left
The "left" RoleSummaries. This should be modified using PolicyUtil.EntitlementSummary.assimilate(boolean, String, boolean, String, Object).

right

public java.util.List<PolicyUtil.RoleSummary> right
The "right" RoleSummaries. This should be modified using PolicyUtil.EntitlementSummary.assimilate(boolean, String, boolean, String, Object).

PolicyUtil.EntitlementSummary

Method Detail

assimilate

public void assimilate(boolean bleft,
                       java.lang.String appname,
                       boolean permission,
                       java.lang.String name,
                       java.lang.Object value)
Assimilate the given entitlement SOD item into the EntitlementSummary.

Parameters:
bleft - True if this is a "left" item, false for "right".
appname - The name of the application for the entitlement.
permission - True if this is a permission.
name - The attribute name or permission target.
value - The attribute value or permission right.

getRoleSummary

public PolicyUtil.RoleSummary getRoleSummary(boolean bleft,
                                             java.lang.String name)
Return a non-null RoleSummary for the attribute with the given name from the left or right list.
